Author: actionslacks#4072
Content: the funny thing is, they could run the tps test, have it independently verified at 100k per sec or whatever, and the price wouldn't move a bit. Not only that, but all the naysayers would chime in ad hominem about "not truly decentralized" etc. Why does it have to be this way?

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: Because it doesn't pump their bags.

Author: yorklab#7270
Content: I think the issue here is that Komodo is still a little fish in a large pool. When they do have something of importance to convey there just isn't a lot of people listening. Many of the other projects getting attention like Tron, Stellar, etc., they partner with a big name company\project who is using, or at least trying their product. Once that happens everyone knows who they are and they get attention every time they sneeze.

Author: Justaguy#6181
Content: Can someone help me out here? I have an assetchain running, and i'm trying to send some of my assetchain coins back and forth for testing. However, i'm getting this error right now: Error: This transaction requires a transaction fee of at least 0.00005 because of its amount, complexity, or use of recently received funds!

Author: Justaguy#6181
Content: is the .00005 talking about a fee of KMD, or is the fee in my own asset chains coins?

Author: ca333#0118
Content: send a little bit less than you are trying to send - the 0.00005 are the TX fee that must be deducted from the send amount

Author: Justaguy#6181
Content: hm that makes sense, lemme try that

Author: Justaguy#6181
Content: @ca333 Thanks for the quick response! That seems to have it working now! üòÑ

Author: Justaguy#6181
Content: one more thing, when I try to send fractions (like .8) I get a JSON error. Though, in the documentation, it seems to support decimals?

Author: ca333#0118
Content: `.8` - try `0.8` instead

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: You can also sendtoaddress YOURADD AMOUNT "" "" true (it will deduct fees from amount)

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: (And btw yes .X are not considered valid at least on sendmany)

Author: Justaguy#6181
Content: @ca333 @Deleted User Hey thanks, you guys are great!

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: adding cryptoconditions is a consensus-changing event, and the main KMD chain has not had cryptoconditions enabled on it, yet. It will first be thoroughly tested on other chains, such as KMDCC, HUSH/etc, and I expect that KMD will get CCs on mainnet when James thinks it's appropriate, and no sooner üòÖ

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: HUSH will be migrating from having ZEC as our upstream to having KMD as our upstream. And we will be enabling a few CCs via -ac_ccenable, which allows you to selectively enable individual CCs. It's very exciting to be able to be one of the first chains to enable them

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: labs enables them all üòÑ

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: but only import/export and oracle on the main chain
